result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerad A Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Jerad A Jones was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jerad A Jones is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Jerad A Jones was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Jerad A Jones was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Jerad A Jones, in custody, appeared with Attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Defendant in custody.  Paul Gilbertson DOC agent in court.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(9:20)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
State - 16CM209 credit 70 days - in 15CM322 credit 91 days - 15CM541 has 91 days credit
Yonko argues sentence credit - has 123 days
Gilbertson - addresses credit time - doesn't have information in file
State - 15CM322 - 90 days jail on Ct 1 agree to time served - Ct 3 6-9 mo jail - 15CM541 90 days jail time served - 16CM209 Ct 4 6-9 mo jail - recommends 6 months consecutive to each other - argues sentence
Yonko - argues time served
Gilbertson - addresses the Court
Deft - addresses the Court

COURT:
15CM322 Ct 1 - 90 days jail credit 90 days
15CM322 Ct 3 - 5 months jail credit 91 days served
15CM541 Ct 1 - 90 days jail credit 90 days
16CM209 Ct 4 - 5 months jail credit 70 days
concurrent to each other
if any other credit should be added - Court will amend
file any monies needed to be made judgment
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 10, 2017 at 09:15 am.

Defendant, Jerad A Jones, appeared personally and without counsel.  Prosecuting attorney Holly Wood Webster appears for the State.  Case called at 9:00 A.M.  Patty Kehne clerk.  Defendant voluntarily waives counsel and is ready to proceed.

15CM322, is first place and State is ready to proceed.  14CM357 also called.

State calls Jordan Jones who testifies after being sworn.  
Defense wishes to make opening statement.
Witness excused after Defense wishes to make opening statement.  
States makes opening statement.
Defense makes opening statement.

9:09 State recalls Jordan Jones who was previously sworn.  Defendant identified.
9:15 - Cross-Examination by Defense.
9:16 - Witness excused.

9:15 - State calls Greg Moen who testifies after being sworn.  Witness identified.
9:25 - Cross-examination by Defendant.
9:25 - witness excused.


9:27 - State calls Barb Vadnais who testifies after being sworn.  Exhibit 1 presented to the witness.   Exhibit 1 marked, offered and received.
State rests.
Defense requests continuance. Court denies.  Defendant addresses the Court.

Defendant testifies after being sworn. Court addresses Defendant's continuance re: hospital records. Court will allow Defendant to make offer of proof.  Accepts offer of proof from Defendant.
Court questions Defendant.  
9:45 - State questions the Defendant.
9:51 - Court addresses the Defendant.
9:53 - witness excused.

Defendant wishes to question Jordan Jones, who was previously sworn.  Jordan Jones testifies.  
State questions Jordan Jones.  

9:59 - Deputy Moen recalled by Defense.

State and Defense make closing arguments to the Court.

COURT FINDS:  Ct. 1 - Finds Guilty
                          Ct. 2 - Finds Not Guilty
                          Ct. 3 - Finds Guilty

State requests probation and jail and/or community service.  State moves to dismiss and read in 14CM357.   30 days jail and/or 180 community service.

Court Orders:  Ct. 1 and Ct. 3, 
Ct. 1, $243 cc, $200 DNA surcharge, $100 DOMAB, w/held sentence, 1 year probation, conditions:  comply with any mental health treatment as required by PO, 180 hours of community service, 
Ct. 3, w/held probation, 1 year probation, $243, $200 DNA surcharge, concurrent to Ct. 1. 20 days to appeal., pplan if needed.

Court:   dismiss and read in 14CM357.

Defendant, Jerad A Jones, appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Janell Evan - Clerk.  3:55 pm and 14CM357

Offer was made but there is no agreement.  

Def is requesting Court Trial.  Defendant waives counsel.

State believes 14CM357 should be tried first.  

COURT - trial on 15CM322 will be 1st
14CM357 - 2nd or to tag along  Court trial scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant, Jerad A Jones, appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Holly D. Wood Webster.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(11:08)
  Deft. waives attorney, reading and speedy trial
         Pleads not guilty

COURT:  waiver of counsel noted - $200 sign bond, photo's & prints
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 04:15 pm.
